author: ryanleeschneider
content: If I sync a CL on a post-Dencun network, will it persist all the recent blobs to disk as part of the sync, or only grab them from the network if "requested" in some way?

author: ajsutton
content: Could be wrong, but I'd expect it to sync them all "automatically" since a block within the retention period shouldn't be considered as a valid fork choice target unless the node actually has any blobs that go with it.  It may not download blobs from orphaned blocks though.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Ok, interesting.  I noticed that one of my Sepolia nodes that'd been running for awhile had 100GB more disk in use than one made from a recent backup of the chain.  Unfortunately I didn't notice until after the old one was retired so I didn't have the actual instance any more so was just trying to think what might've led to the discrepancy.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: But actually ya it couldn't have been retained blobs anyways, since they would've been included in the backup. ðŸ™‚

author: ajsutton
content: oh the exception is possibly if you snapshot sync. There's no real point checking you can download blobs for blocks before the snapshot because they are by definition canonical anyway.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Ya this wasn't a snapshot sync, rather our bespoke process where we stop the EL/CL on a node then backup it's local disk, then restore it on a new node.  Anyways thanks for the clarification, good to know; I'll keep an eye to see if I notice it happening again (hopefully while the node is still available next time ðŸ™‚ )
